content.description: Another awesome GS traverse on small holds.  Start on the far right side of the boulder just down the hill from the Breadloaf boulder and traverse left, topping out just as you run into another boulder on your left (that one's off).
content.protection: A few pads.  The traverse is longish and there's a big pointy rock toward the end.
content.location: Just off the trail to the left, down the hill from Breadloaf

content.description: In the corridor downhill from Cobra is a 20 degree overhanging face.  Enter the corridor from the Huck face around and right of Juggernaut.  Pull onto two thin crimps at head height.  Get a foot onto a small chip and snatch a slanting one pad crimp with the left hand.  Move up into a large right facing sidepull flake with the right hand and then mantel easily with the aid of jug at the lip.  There is a tall steep slab paralleling this overhang with a horizontal shelf near the bottom.  The landing is precarious in a narrow slot corridor.  It is a poor landing, so bring a good spotter or two and pads.
content.location: In the corridor downhill of Cobra, entering from the Huck face.

content.description: Ungreased is a neat little steep slab with smeary feet and some cool subtle handholds.  It would be a perfect problem for a rank beginner, but even I find it very enjoyable.  The movement is sublime, with great rock quality and incredible friction.
content.protection: One pad is more than adequate.
content.location: This problem is on the shorter, uphill side of the Breadloaf boulder.  It is right of the very easy slab problem Bread Slab.  The climb is almost a blunt arete slab feature.

content.description:
This project will climb the center of the tall face on the downstream side of the Breadloaf boulder.  This tall, alluring face has been contemplated by every visitor to the Stables, since the late 1970's or early 1980's I would imagine.  It is the most obvious project at all of Governor Stables, partly due to it's proximity to the entrance, and also the fact that it is the proudest line on one of the best boulders.   

  Start off of the flat rock at the base.  Begin on the good holds in the horizontal crack.  Move up to a solitary sidepull, then somehow span the five or six foot blank vertical face to the top of the boulder.  The only feasible way to work this project would be with a top rope, because it is a tall boulder.  The grade is merely a guess, as I had to put something to enter this into the database.  The problem does not seem that hard upon first glance, but believe me, it is a very long reach from the good sidepull to the lip of the boulder, and it is very sloping as well.  Someday, someone very tall may complete this problem.  This is one of the last great projects at Governor Stables.
content.protection: Pads and spotters, or a top rope to work out the moves.
content.location: Center of the tall downstream side of the Breadloaf boulder.

content.description: Sit start using opposing crimps, slap with the right hand to a sloper, then move up to the crimps and mantle.
content.location: The boulder in front of Cobra.

content.description: Great little one move wonder on the boulder in front of Cobra.  Sit start on two sharp crimps, figure out your feet, and fire for the lip.
content.location: Stand in front of the Cobra pit.  Look at the chalk.  This is the left line.  Slap Me (V7) is the right.  Both are pretty cool but very short.

content.description: This short problem will catch your eye.  Sit start and paw the arete.  Think about it, reposition, pull, and go for the lip!  A novelty problem at its finest.
content.protection: You'll want a pad because chances are you will be landing on your arse a few times.
content.location: On the small boulder next to Yeast and Knead It.

content.description: Party Right starts in the same place as the problem Keg Stand (V2).  Begin by jumping to a large flat jug from standing on a flat rock.  Campus traverse leftwards along a steep wall with poor feet and hands working good edges on "elephant skin" rock features.  Gain the arete/apex and then engage the crux.  Heel hook the right foot on or near the starting jug hold, and then make an insecure and slightly frightening mantel with the left hand meat-wrapping the corner.  There is not really a hold for the right hand on the blank bulge.  Balance and rock up hard and high on the right heel hook perch to reach the sloping lip with the right hand.  Breathe and top out.  This is a challenging problem for the grade but is well worth it.  It is a steep face on good holds which is a rarity on diabase.
content.protection: Two pads and a good spotter or two is preferable.
content.location: Party Right is on the narrow and steep side of the Breadloaf boulder, closest to the Stables entrance.

content.description: Harder than it looks, sit start with good holds and huge foot ledge.  Make a couple hard moves to good holds, then bust up for the juggy lip and make a fun topout.
content.protection: 1 pad to cover the pointy rock in the top-out fall zone
content.location: Boulder to the left of Yeast

content.description: Keg Stand starts off of a raised flat boulder at the base.  Hop up to a flat two handed jug hold if you are of normal height (or grasp it with your feet planted if you are very tall) and work up a short bulge to the lip and top out.
content.protection: One, or maybe two pads if you are not comfortable with the landing, and a spotter.
content.location: This problem is on the narrow side of the rectangular boulder, on the steep side that is closest to the Stables entrance.  It is right of the Breadloaf Arete.

content.description: Stand Start on a three finger left hand crimp and a small right hand crimp, either dyno or pull on small crimps to grab the lip.
content.location: The start is near the inside corner of the Yeast boulder formed by the Knead it and Yeast boulders.

content.description: Start on undercling
content.location: Right of bread crumbs. Right middle line

content.description: Cobra is widely regarded as one of the best problems at Governor Stable.  Ignore the scary landing and give it a burn, you won't be disappointed.
content.protection: A few pads to line the back slab and the pit
content.location: In between Yeast and Moby's Dick

content.description: Start in the center of the wide, tall Breadloaf boulder face on top of the rock at the base near a tree.  Pull onto the rock and traverse rightwards along a horizontal crack with decent edges.  After eight feet or so, climb into the sloping crimp crux of the Breadloaf arete, then finish up the standard problem.
content.protection: Pads and spotters.  The finish is somewhat high and insecure.

content.description: A classic to end all classics!  High and spicey, Breadloaf arete is a must-do problem at Governor Stable.  Start low on the arete of the giant boulder that looks like a breadloaf i guess, and make delicate moves toward an exciting finish.  Not to be missed!
content.protection: A few pads.  The landing's okay but the top-out is high
content.location: Past the warm up area, take the first trail to your right and follow it to the top of the hill.

content.description: Walk up this nice little slab.  This would be a great problem for a first time climber.  It is secure and fun.
content.protection: No protection is really necessary for this problem.
content.location: On the shorter, uphill side of the Breadloaf boulder.  It is on the right side of the face, a few feet right of a tree if you are looking at this face.  It is a couple of feet left of the rightmost, blunt arete.

content.description: Reach up to the jug and top out from there.
content.location: Boulder to the left of the breadloaf boulder, if you're looking uphill. This is the face, looking uphill. Several easy climbs. This line is left middle. See photo.

content.description: Bread Box climbs the narrow face that is left of the main, tall Breadloaf boulder face.  It begins with hands in a rectangular slot feature at chest level (the bread box).  A loaf of bread would fit perfectly into this starting hold.  Climb up the vertical face using crimps to reach knobs near the lip and then mantel.
content.protection: One pad and perhaps a spotter.
content.location: The narrow face of the Breadloaf boulder that faces away from the Stables entrance.  It is right of the slab problem Ungreased.

content.description: Bisquack is the acute corner crack that is formed by the intersection of the Doughboy's Throne boulder on the right (containing the leftward traverse Yeast) and the smaller boulder to the left (containing the rightward traverse Knead It).  Start low and climb the corner crack then top out.
content.location: This is the corner crack where the two boulders meet that are downhill from the large Breadloaf boulder proper.

content.description: The area around Breadloaf Arete.
